intro: Lingnania transvenula, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually evergreen and arranged in pairs along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Lingnania transvenula is found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid forests where it thrives on shaded canopy layers.
